title: (Pwn2Own) Lexmark MC3224i setuid Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Lexmark MC3224i printers. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the permissions set on root-owned service files. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of root.
addtionnal_details: Lexmark has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://publications.lexmark.com/publications/security-alerts/CVE-2021-44735.pdf
timeline:
2021-12-30 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-02-15 - Coordinated public release of advisory
